Summary: 1. Games can be learned from human expert preferences, or from self-play (or a combination) 2. TD-Learning is a general method, which does not rely on knowing the world model 3. TreeStrap is more powerful, because it also renes the value of moves which were not chosen; but it relies on knowing the world model 4. Monte Carlo tree search good for games with large branching factor 5. Deep Learning for Go, Atari Games 6. Starcraft? c(cid:13)Alan Blair, 2015-18
